alert.note: Alert for Carver (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 11:06AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Chippewa River at Durand affecting Buffalo, Dunn and Pepin Counties. Chippewa River at Eau Claire affecting Eau Claire County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt upstream snowpack and increase river flows for the next few days. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Crow River below Mayer. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, The bridge on 84th Street is closed. Road closures include 42nd Street between Tacoma Avenue and County Road 123; County road 23 north of Mayer and County Road 27 in Watertown; and County Road 32 from County Road 135 to Vega Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning and continue rising to a crest of 14.5 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 06/28/2013. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
